p: The new block geometry was implemented in STIR version 3.0. STIR makes use of the object-oriented features of C++. The library contains main building blocks including categorized classes to describe certain kinds of object with their functionalities, e.g., to describe images, 3D sinograms, forward/backward projection, iterative image reconstruction algorithms, and reading/writing interfile headers (I/O) [ 12]. We now describe these features in more detail.
